content: the same charts on both socks same or different order for a matching or near matching pair work different charts on each sock if you do this you will need to do a little maths to make sure your socks are about the same length when finished as the charts vary in height if you like fraternal socks work one sock with dark mc and the other with light mc to ensure that the motif charts are centred a table for each size is provided indicating what stitch you need to start with for each section of the sock the tables are included on the motif charts page for easy reference knit 2 mc rounds plain rounds between each chart maintaining the side/centre sole stripes i would recommend using lbj to catch long floats ɸ the motif charts are named according to the stitch count per repeat for example motif chart 6b has a 6 stitch repeat and the b indicates that it is the second chart with that stitch count pattern layout and printing information the examples charts and chart written instructions are located after the pattern instructions the printing guide below allows you to choose which pages you need pattern and charts dark mc light mc motif and small gusset charts p 1-9 12-13 p 1-9 16-17 motif and medium gusset charts p 1-9 12 and 14 p 1-9 16 and 18 motif and large gusset charts p 1-9 12 and 15 p 1-9 16 and 19 pattern and chart written instructions motif and small gusset p 1-9 20-24 motif and medium gusset p 1-9 20-23 and 25 motif and large gusset p 1-9 20-23 and 26-27 examples how to work a motif chart and 2 plain rounds p 10 what each motif looks like repeated/knitted p 11 2 motif charts source knittingfool this pattern is for personal use only ©lorraine rayson 2024 s-64 m-72 l-80 searching for king sexred-toe up-v01-230824 page 3 / 27 abbreviations bor beginning of round cc/mc contrast colour/main colour rs/ws right side/wrong side st/sts stitch/stitches repeat instructions markers pm place marker sm slip marker gm# gusset marker number ssm# side stripe marker number basic stitches k knit p purl sl slip_stitch slip_stitch purlwise unless otherwise stated increases/decreases kfb knit front and back knit into front and back of stitch 1 st increased m1l make 1 left insert left needle from front lifting the bar between the current and the next stitch through back loop 1 st increased m1r make 1 right insert left needle from back lifting the bar between the current and next stitch knit through front loop 1 st increased lliɸ left lifted increase insert left needle into left leg of stitch 2 row below stitch just worked knit through back loop 1 st increased rliɸ right lifted increase insert right needle from front into purl bump of stitch on left needle knit alternative method pick up right leg of stitch below the next stitch on left-hand needle and knit 1
